Package Datastructures.Theory

Class Model

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Theory.Model
public class Model extends Object
This class represents a propositional model, i.e. a set of literals which are supposed to be true.
When a literal is added to the model, and its negation is already in the model then an Unsatisfiable exception is thrown. This usually terminates the search.
Besides the mapping of literals to true/false, this class provides the following services to the system:
  • Each literal in the model is accompanied by the inference step that caused the literal to be true.
    This allows one to reconstruct the results of the search for a model or the unsatisfiability of the clauses.
  • One can install observers. These are functions which get automatically called when a new true literal is added to the model.
    The observers distribute the information about the literal to the other reasoners.
Critical methods in the model are synchronized such that they can be called from different threats.

  • Field Details

    • predicates

      public int predicates
      the maximum number of predicates.

    • model

      public it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntArrayList model
      the current model. It collects the true literals.

    • inferenceSteps

      public ArrayList<InferenceSteps.InferenceStep> inferenceSteps
      the inference steps which caused the truth of the literals. The positions in the array are the same as the positions of the true literal in the model-array.

    • status

      private byte[] status
      maps predicates in the model to +1 (true), -1 (false) or 0 (undefined). It provides the fastest lookup of a literals status in the model.

    • observers

      private final ArrayList<BiConsumer<Integer,InferenceSteps.InferenceStep>> observers
      functions to be called when a new true literal is inserted.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model(int predicates)
      creates a model with a maximum number of predicates.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(BiConsumer<Integer,InferenceSteps.InferenceStep> observer)
      adds a new observer which gets called when a new true literal is inserted. An observer is a function to be called for the true literal and the corresponding inference step.
      Parameters:
      observer - a function (literal,inference-step)

    • add

      public void add(int... literals) throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      adds a literal to the model with null inference step.
      Parameters:
      literals - some literals.
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction is found.

    • add

      public void add(int literal, InferenceSteps.InferenceStep inferenceStep) throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      adds a literal to the model and checks if the literal is already in the model. If the literal is new to the model then all observers are called. If the literal is already false in the model then an UnsatisfiableLiteral exception is thrown with the literal, the old inference step and the new inference step.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal for the model.
      inferenceStep - the inference step that caused the truth of the model.
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.UnsatisfiableLiteral - if a contradiction with an earlier entry in the model occurs.
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable

    • addImmediately

      public void addImmediately(int literal)
      adds a literal immediately without any checks and inference step. No observers are called. This method is useful for algorithms which work with candidate models and backtracking.
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal

    • isTrue

      public boolean isTrue(int literal)
      checks if the literal is true in the model.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the literal is true in the model.

    • status

      public int status(int literal)
      returns the status of the literal in the model.
      Parameters:
      literal - the literal to be checked.
      Returns:
      +1 if the literal is true in the model, -1 if it is false in the model, otherwise 0.

      Returns:
